Maguire, Jr., an individual investor focused on early stage investment in breakthrough renewable energy generation technologies. Read More....

  Namaste Solar Responds to Suspension of Xcel Energy's Solar Rewards Program

On Thursday, March 3, 2011, as a direct result of Xcel Energys unilateral decision to suspend the Solar* Rewards incentive program, Namast Solar made the difficult decision to reduce its Colorado-based workforce by 12 people (or 16%) . This prudent reduction of overhead is part of a broader company restructuring strategy to adapt to the uncertainty of Colorados solar market and to maintain the companys long-standing financial health. Read More....

  • Energy

  Boulder's Wind Power and Renewable Energy Credits

In this program, you pay a small fee in addition to your normal energy bill, which guarantees that the amount of energy you use will be generated by renewable sources and fed to the electricity grid on your behalf. You also become exempt from paying fuel cost and air quality improvement charges. Read More....

Submitted by fewresources on Wed, 02/09/2011 - 10:28

 
  • Energy

  Boulder's Solar Energy Program

Boulder has an average of 300 sunny days a year, making it a great place for solar energy applications. With the passage of Amendment 37 in Colorado in 2004, most local utility companies offer substantial incentives for installing an on-site solar electric system (photovoltaic or PV). Additionally, there are federal tax credits in place for both PV and solar thermal (hot water) systems. Read More....

 

Submitted by fewresources on Tue, 02/08/2011 - 12:57

  Boulder County Towns Ramp Up Municipal Solar Installations

Over the last three years, cities and towns from Erie to Boulder have gone from being virtually solar-free to installing more than 2.5 megawatts worth of photovoltaic panels to power their needs at water and wastewater treatment plants, libraries and recreation centers. Read More....
